answers.answer: HI and thanks for using the forum.Since you already discussed the blood in your sputum with your doctor, it is probably exactly what he/she said-  you can pop blood vessesl with frequent, coarse coughing.  This would give you some tinges of blood in your sputum.  However, if the bleeding is occuring every time you cough and is more than a few tinges of blood, I would have it checked out again.The foot ulcers were probably related to the blood clots which were probably from the torn muscle/tendons.   The smoking does not help the matter since it causes vascular compromise and can lead to blood clots as well.  The quicker you "kick the habit" the better.I find your shortness of breath a little concerning (mostly because of your smoking history and because of your history of a blood clot) and would recommend you see your doctor and have a chest x-ray and some blood work if warranted.Good luck,Bridget
